title: 820-3115 PLT_RESET_L 0V
message:
Clean board, client states that Mac started to have issues starting up, but once was on it worked fine, sometimes it took many tries to get it to start.

C6603 was partially shorted and burned (PP5V_S3) after replacement diode reading is correct but board still has same problem.

Already tried heating up PCH but same problem, tried new SMC and same thing.

title: 820-3115 PLT_RESET_L 0V
message: Which voltages do you actually get on the MLB?

title: 820-3115 PLT_RESET_L 0V
message: I forgot you cannot yet read my mind sorry, MLB makes it all the way to 0.9V on PPVCCSA_S0_CPU, I get USB power but no activity, already tried clean bios as well.

title: 820-3115 PLT_RESET_L 0V
message:
Check basic voltages of U7400; pins 19, 29, 46, 47.
Also check R7402/03.

title: 820-3115 PLT_RESET_L 0V
message:
So missing ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
Remove Q7950 and test again.

title: 820-3115 PLT_RESET_L 0V
message: Right, after removing Q7950  ALL_SYS_PWRGD only went up to 0.3V

title: 820-3115 PLT_RESET_L 0V
message:
U7400 gets 3V at pin 47?
Do you note a drop pulse at pins 1 & 48?

title: 820-3115 PLT_RESET_L 0V
message:
U7400 gets 3V at pin 47? negative, board gets 0.3V there too.

Do you note a drop pulse at pins 1 & 48? No, when I plug charger it starts at 12V and stays there on both pins.

title: 820-3115 PLT_RESET_L 0V
message:
Sorry for my error.
I was thinking you've got 3V at ALL_SYS_PWRGD; you have 0.3V instead.

Do you get correct voltage at all other big coils (apart of VCORE)?

title: 820-3115 PLT_RESET_L 0V
message:
No problem,  ALL_SYS_PWRGD is 0.3V also.
L7760 PP1V8_S0 is 0.03V 
L7550 is 0V
All other coils get their propper voltage

title: 820-3115 PLT_RESET_L 0V
message:
Check diode mode to ground at L7760.
Post U7760 voltages; IN, EN, SS/REFIN.

title: 820-3115 PLT_RESET_L 0V
message:
Diode mode to ground at L7760 is 204
U7760 
IN 0.3V
EN 1.05v
SS/REFIN 0V

title: 820-3115 PLT_RESET_L 0V
message: Q7830 was the culprit of all the problems, thanks a lot for your help!

title: 820-3115 PLT_RESET_L 0V
message: Initially replaced Q7830 and Q7810 and board worked a few times but it failed again, then replaced Q7812 and so far it is still working.
